name: Oaken Bolter
damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine
condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
languages: understands one language of its creator but can\'t speak

traits.Magic Resistance: The oaken bolter has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.Multiattack: The oaken bolter makes two lancing bolt attacks or one lancing bolt attack and one harpoon attack.
actions.Lancing Bolt: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7+1d6 + 4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage.
actions.Harpoon: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7+1d6 + 4 to hit, range 50/200 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 12+1d6 + 9). While grappled in this way, a creature's speed isn't reduced, but it can move only in directions that bring it closer to the oaken bolter. A creature takes 5 (1d10) slashing damage if it escapes from the grapple or if it tries and fails. As a bonus action, the oaken bolter can pull a creature grappled by it 20 feet closer. The oaken bolter can grapple only one creature at a time.
actions.Explosive Bolt (Recharge 5xe2x80x936): The oaken bolter launches an explosive charge at a point within 120 feet. Each creature within 20 feet of that point must make a DC 15+1d6 + 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
